     164              : /*! \class rapidjson::Handler
     165              :     \brief Concept for receiving events from GenericReader upon parsing.

     167              :     the event publisher should terminate the process.

     170              :     typename Ch;
     171              : 
     172              :     bool Null();

     180              :     bool RawNumber(const Ch* str, SizeType length, bool copy);
     181              :     bool String(const Ch* str, SizeType length, bool copy);
     182              :     bool StartObject();
     183              :     bool Key(const Ch* str, SizeType length, bool copy);
     184              :     bool EndObject(SizeType memberCount);
     185              :     bool StartArray();
     186              :     bool EndArray(SizeType elementCount);
     187              : };
     188              : \endcode

     190              : ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
     191              : // BaseReaderHandler
     192              : 
     193              : //! Default implementation of Handler.
     194              : /*! This can be used as base class of any reader handler.
     195              :     \note implements Handler concept
     196              : */
     197              : template<typename Encoding = UTF8<>, typename Derived = void>
     198              : struct BaseReaderHandler {
     199              :     typedef typename Encoding::Ch Ch;
     200              : 
     201              :     typedef typename internal::SelectIf<internal::IsSame<Derived, void>, BaseReaderHandler, Derived>::Type Override;
     202              : 
     203              :     bool Default() { return true; }
     204              :     bool Null() { return static_cast<Override&>(*this).Default(); }
     205              :     bool Bool(bool) { return static_cast<Override&>(*this).Default(); }
     206              :     bool Int(int) { return static_cast<Override&>(*this).Default(); }
     207              :     bool Uint(unsigned) { return static_cast<Override&>(*this).Default(); }
     208              :     bool Int64(int64_t) { return static_cast<Override&>(*this).Default(); }
     209              :     bool Uint64(uint64_t) { return static_cast<Override&>(*this).Default(); }
     210              :     bool Double(double) { return static_cast<Override&>(*this).Default(); }
     211              :     /// enabled via kParseNumbersAsStringsFlag, string is not null-terminated (use length)
     212              :     bool RawNumber(const Ch* str, SizeType len, bool copy) { return static_cast<Override&>(*this).String(str, len, copy); }
     213              :     bool String(const Ch*, SizeType, bool) { return static_cast<Override&>(*this).Default(); }
     214              :     bool StartObject() { return static_cast<Override&>(*this).Default(); }
     215              :     bool Key(const Ch* str, SizeType len, bool copy) { return static_cast<Override&>(*this).String(str, len, copy); }
     216              :     bool EndObject(SizeType) { return static_cast<Override&>(*this).Default(); }
     217              :     bool StartArray() { return static_cast<Override&>(*this).Default(); }
     218              :     bool EndArray(SizeType) { return static_cast<Override&>(*this).Default(); }
     219              : };

     520              : // GenericReader

     522              : //! SAX-style JSON parser. Use \ref Reader for UTF8 encoding and default allocator.
     523              : /*! GenericReader parses JSON text from a stream, and send events synchronously to an
     524              :     object implementing Handler concept.
     525              : 
     526              :     It needs to allocate a stack for storing a single decoded string during
     527              :     non-destructive parsing.
     528              : 
     529              :     For in-situ parsing, the decoded string is directly written to the source
     530              :     text string, no temporary buffer is required.
     531              : 
     532              :     A GenericReader object can be reused for parsing multiple JSON text.
     533              : 
     534              :     \tparam SourceEncoding Encoding of the input stream.
     535              :     \tparam TargetEncoding Encoding of the parse output.

    2008              :     // Make an advance in the token stream and state based on the candidate destination state which was returned by Transit().
    2009              :     // May return a new state on state pop.
    2010              :     template <unsigned parseFlags, typename InputStream, typename Handler>
    2011            0 :     RAPIDJSON_FORCEINLINE IterativeParsingState Transit(IterativeParsingState src, Token token, IterativeParsingState dst, InputStream& is, Handler& handler) {
    2012            0 :         (void)token;
    2013            0 : 
    2014            0 :         switch (dst) {
    2015            0 :         case IterativeParsingErrorState:
    2016            0 :             return dst;
    2017            0 : 
    2018            0 :         case IterativeParsingObjectInitialState:
    2019            0 :         case IterativeParsingArrayInitialState:
    2020            0 :         {
    2021            0 :             // Push the state(Element or MemeberValue) if we are nested in another array or value of member.
    2022            0 :             // In this way we can get the correct state on ObjectFinish or ArrayFinish by frame pop.
    2023            0 :             IterativeParsingState n = src;
    2024            0 :             if (src == IterativeParsingArrayInitialState || src == IterativeParsingElementDelimiterState)
    2025            0 :                 n = IterativeParsingElementState;
    2026            0 :             else if (src == IterativeParsingKeyValueDelimiterState)
    2027            0 :                 n = IterativeParsingMemberValueState;
    2028            0 :             // Push current state.
    2029            0 :             *stack_.template Push<SizeType>(1) = n;
    2030            0 :             // Initialize and push the member/element count.
    2031            0 :             *stack_.template Push<SizeType>(1) = 0;
    2032            0 :             // Call handler
    2033            0 :             bool hr = (dst == IterativeParsingObjectInitialState) ? handler.StartObject() : handler.StartArray();
    2034            0 :             // On handler short circuits the parsing.
    2035            0 :             if (!hr) {
    2036            0 :                 RAPIDJSON_PARSE_ERROR_NORETURN(kParseErrorTermination, is.Tell());
    2037            0 :                 return IterativeParsingErrorState;
    2038            0 :             }
    2039            0 :             else {
    2040            0 :                 is.Take();
    2041            0 :                 return dst;
    2042            0 :             }
    2043            0 :         }
    2044            0 : 
    2045            0 :         case IterativeParsingMemberKeyState:
    2046            0 :             ParseString<parseFlags>(is, handler, true);
    2047            0 :             if (HasParseError())
    2048            0 :                 return IterativeParsingErrorState;
    2049            0 :             else
    2050            0 :                 return dst;
    2051            0 : 
    2052            0 :         case IterativeParsingKeyValueDelimiterState:
    2053            0 :             RAPIDJSON_ASSERT(token == ColonToken);
    2054            0 :             is.Take();
    2055            0 :             return dst;
    2056            0 : 
    2057            0 :         case IterativeParsingMemberValueState:
    2058            0 :             // Must be non-compound value. Or it would be ObjectInitial or ArrayInitial state.
    2059            0 :             ParseValue<parseFlags>(is, handler);
    2060            0 :             if (HasParseError()) {
    2061            0 :                 return IterativeParsingErrorState;
    2062            0 :             }
    2063            0 :             return dst;
    2064            0 : 
    2065            0 :         case IterativeParsingElementState:
    2066            0 :             // Must be non-compound value. Or it would be ObjectInitial or ArrayInitial state.
    2067            0 :             ParseValue<parseFlags>(is, handler);
    2068            0 :             if (HasParseError()) {
    2069            0 :                 return IterativeParsingErrorState;
    2070            0 :             }
    2071            0 :             return dst;
    2072            0 : 
    2073            0 :         case IterativeParsingMemberDelimiterState:
    2074            0 :         case IterativeParsingElementDelimiterState:
    2075            0 :             is.Take();
    2076            0 :             // Update member/element count.
    2077            0 :             *stack_.template Top<SizeType>() = *stack_.template Top<SizeType>() + 1;
    2078            0 :             return dst;
    2079            0 : 
    2080            0 :         case IterativeParsingObjectFinishState:

    2089            0 :             // If the object is not empty, count the last member.
    2090            0 :             if (src == IterativeParsingMemberValueState)

    2095            0 :             if (n == IterativeParsingStartState)

    2098            0 :             bool hr = handler.EndObject(c);

    2101            0 :                 RAPIDJSON_PARSE_ERROR_NORETURN(kParseErrorTermination, is.Tell());
    2102            0 :                 return IterativeParsingErrorState;
    2103            0 :             }
    2104            0 :             else {
    2105            0 :                 is.Take();
    2106            0 :                 return n;

    2112            0 :             // Transit from delimiter is only allowed when trailing commas are enabled
    2113            0 :             if (!(parseFlags & kParseTrailingCommasFlag) && src == IterativeParsingElementDelimiterState) {

    2116            0 :             }
    2117            0 :             // Get element count.

    2128            0 :             bool hr = handler.EndArray(c);
    2129            0 :             // On handler short circuits the parsing.
    2130            0 :             if (!hr) {
    2131            0 :                 RAPIDJSON_PARSE_ERROR_NORETURN(kParseErrorTermination, is.Tell());
    2132            0 :                 return IterativeParsingErrorState;
    2133            0 :             }
    2134            0 :             else {
    2135            0 :                 is.Take();
    2136            0 :                 return n;
    2137            0 :             }
    2138            0 :         }
    2139            0 : 
    2140            0 :         default:

    2142            0 :             // Use `default:` rather than

    2147            0 : 
    2148            0 :             // The IterativeParsingFinishState is not enumerated in this switch-case either.
    2149            0 :             // It is a "derivative" state which cannot triggered from Predict() directly.
    2150            0 :             // Therefore it cannot happen here. And it can be caught by following assertion.
    2151            0 :             RAPIDJSON_ASSERT(dst == IterativeParsingValueState);
    2152            0 :

    2155            0 :             if (HasParseError()) {
    2156            0 :                 return IterativeParsingErrorState;
    2157            0 :             }
    2158            0 :             return IterativeParsingFinishState;
    2159            0 :         }
    2160            0 :     }

    2165            0 :             // Error flag has been set.
